RECORD.TEXT: Discharge Summary DIS 04/14/1991 Report Status : Signed PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : VAGINAL CANCER . VAGINAL CYLINDER PLACEMENT 4/15/91 . The patient is a 76-year-old woman with a history of multiple medical problems who presented with vaginal bleeding . A mass was palpable on vaginal exam and a biopsy was performed which revealed squamous cell carcinoma . The patient was admitted on 4/14/91 and at that time was noted to have a creatinine of 1.5 . A vaginal cylinder radiation implant was then inserted and remained in place for 27 hours delivering 2255 centrigray . She tolerated this well . The implant was removed and she was discharged home on 4/17/91 with plans for follow-up by Dr. Horner . LL162/6571 AUNI HORNER , M.D. WA44 Batch : T : 10/09/91 TIANSHA KOTE , M.D. OZ06
